page.title: 16COMMUNITY COUNCIL ACTIVITIES
page.content: The Community Council helps the village a lot. They organise Car Boot Sales on the playing field and they run a Fifty-Fifty shop. They also arrange dances, discos, barbeques and things like that. There is a monthly newsletter which gives all the news from organisations in the village. A lot of events are held in the village hall or the old school room. Two of the biggest things they have run this year is the Mini-Marathon and May Fayre. All the money that has been raised is to be used for the new Community Centre which will be built together with the new school. THE MAY FAYRE On the first bank holiday in May, Mendlesham holds a street fayre. One of the main village roads is closed and flags are hung from house to house.
